revised_title: The Nervous and Muscular Structures in Aquatic Larva of Tipula crystallina
tldr: This study examines the relationship between nerves and muscular structures in the aquatic larva of Tipula crystallina. The author, Richard L. Maddox, describes two methods of nerve termination and their relation to the muscles. He also discusses the blood corpuscles, or creeping corpuscles, and their importance in the movement of living matter. The research highlights the difficulties in accurately depicting the nervous and muscular structures due to factors like muscular contraction and tissue thickness.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
